oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pikeville Chapel AME Zion Church: historic photograph of students standing at church entrance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pikeville Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church
East Valley Road, Pikeville, Bledsoe Co., TN
Black and white photograph of adults and students outside of the church building. Approximately fifty individuals are pictured, the majority of them children. Several adults stand to the left.

Pikeville African Methodist Episcopal Church was built c. 1870 and is believed to be the oldest rural African American Church building in Tennessee. The church building also served as a school, known as Lincoln Academy, that served the Black population of the Pikeville area until the Lincoln School opened in 1925 with support of the Rosenwald Fund. The church is still in use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; African Methodist Episcopal Church
Churches; Group portraits
